info.title: ðŸ’™ CHAINSTACK PLATFORM API
info.description:
A set of API endpoints to operate and manage the platform resources.
See also a [quick API tutorial](https://docs.chainstack.com/reference/quick-tutorial).

get.description: Get the name and ID of your organization.

patch.description: Change the name of your organization.

get.description: List all projects your organization is part of.

patch.description: Change project name and project description.

get.description: Retrieve members of a consortium project.
List all networks your organization is part of.

patch.description: Change the network name. Only for `consortium` projects.

get.description: List all nodes in the networks your organization is part of.

post.description: Retrieve a token required to access a third-party application from Chainstack Marketplace.

APIKeyAuthentication.description:
Chainstack API uses [API keys](https://docs.chainstack.com/reference/platform-api-getting-started) to authenticate requests. You can view and manage your API keys in the platform UI.
Your API keys carry many privileges, so be sure to keep them secure!
Provide your API key as the `Authorization` header. The value of the header consists of `Bearer` prefix and secret key generated through the platform UI.

```bash
curl -X GET 'https://api.chainstack.com/v1/organization/' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer FX7CWlLg.FMpAO8cgCX2N7s41EncRru2nb5CmTZUt'
```

All API requests must be made over HTTPS.

ProjectTypeEnum.description:
Type of the project.
* `public` for public chain project

count.description: Number of the objects in the paginated results.

members.description:
Number of members invited to the consortium project.
Only for the `consortium` project.

networks.description: Number of networks created in the project.

ProjectMember.description: Member organization of the consortium project.

network.description:
Network to join.
See also [Binance Smart Chain networks](https://docs.chainstack.com/operations/bsc/networks).

NodeTypeEnum.description:
Type of the node.
Available types: * `shared` â€” only for `ethereum`, `polygon-pos`, `bsc`, `avalanche`, `fantom`, `tezos`, `bitcoin` * `dedicated` â€” for all protocols

Region.description:
Regions the nodes are deployed to.

Available for `gcloud`:
* `asia-southeast1`

Available for `aws`:
* `ap-southeast-1`
* `us-west-2`
* `us-east-1`

Available for `azure`:
* `uksouth`

Available for `vzo`:
* `eu3`

archive.description:
Pass `true` if you want to access full blockchain data and an archive of historical states.
See more about [archive nodes](https://docs.chainstack.com/operations/ethereum/modes).

See more about [archive nodes](https://docs.chainstack.com/operations/polygon/modes).

* Required for `consortium` networks.
* Autogenerated for `public chain` networks.

Pass `{}` if there are no specific parameters for the chosen protocol.

ProjectOrdering.name: order_by
ProjectOrdering.description:
Which field to use when ordering the results.
Use the `-` prefix to perform descending ordering (`-name`).

Pagination.name: page
Pagination.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

Id.name: id
Id.description: A unique value identifying the Object.

NetworkOrdering.name: order_by
NetworkOrdering.description:
Which field to use when ordering the results.
Use the `-` prefix to perform descending ordering (`-name`).

NodeOrdering.name: order_by
NodeOrdering.description:
Which field to use when ordering the results.
Use the `-` prefix to perform descending ordering (`-name`).

RegionFilter.name: region
RegionFilter.description: Filter by the region the node is deployed to.

ProviderFilter.name: provider
ProviderFilter.description: Filter by the cloud provider of the node.

ArchiveFilter.name: archive
ArchiveFilter.description: Filter Ethereum, Polygon PoS, Binance Smart Chain, Avalanche, Fantom, and Tezos nodes by the archive mode flag.

Slug.name: slug
Slug.description: A unique value identifying the marketplace application.

folder_id.description: ID of the folder. If no ID - search by root folder

q.description: filter by internal ID / CID / title

sort.description:
valid JSON object with two fields: `field` and `order`
- \<field\> can be: `ID`, `CID`, `type`, `title`, `status`, `size`, `created_at`, `updated_at`, `bucket_id`, `folder_id`, `public_link`, `owner`, `creator`
- \<order\> can be: `ASC`, `DESC` (can be in lowercase), or empty (asc by default)

IpfsApiId.name: id
IpfsApiId.description: A unique value identifying the Object.
